info.title: Human Musculature (Side View)
info.text: The following image is a depiction of the human musculature labeled by the scientific classifications. This piece is an example of a classic line drawing where the entire composition is composed through the use of subtle line variations and mixed pencil pressure sensitivity.

info.title: Human Cross-Section (Back View)
info.text: An alternate view, part of the same series.  This particular image is a medical cross-section, which contrasts the human musculature against the outermost skin tissue. The musculature is again depicted as a classic line drawing, while the skin tissue is composed using softer shading techniques.

info.title: Human Cross-Section (Front View)
info.text: An alternate view, part of the same series.  This image offers a different view of a human body cross-section. This time, however, both sides of the image are composed through layering of both classic line drawing and softer shading techniques.

info.title: Human Skeletal Scan (Front View)
info.text: An alternate view, part of the same series.  The following image depicts an x-ray scan of the human body and examines the human skeletal structure of the chest cavity and lower torso.
